meanings.definition: To give strength or courage to
meanings.sent1: Seeing his friends cheer him on during the race really heartened him.
meanings.sent2: The kind words from his coach heartened him before the big game.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's imaginary superhero cape seemed to hearten her as she faced the dark closet.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected support from strangers heartened him like a warm embrace on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the finish line ahead heartened him to push through the pain and exhaustion.

meanings.definition: To make more cheerful or hopeful
meanings.sent1: The surprise visit from her best friend heartened her on a gloomy day.
meanings.sent2: The colorful flowers in the garden never failed to hearten her spirits.
meanings.sent3: The playful antics of the puppy never failed to hearten the grumpy old man next door.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song heartened her soul like a gentle breeze on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent5: The encouraging words from her mentor heartened her to pursue her dreams with renewed determination.
